page.title: 19STANTONBURY PARISH
page.content: There are quite a lot of churches in the Stantonbury parish in Milton Keynes. One church is Christchurch, Stantonbury. In New Bradwell village there is an old church with a spire. The church is St. James. There is another small village called Bradwell village, its parish church is called St. Lawrence. Down's Barn has not got a church but Christians use Down's Barn School hall as their meeting place. Giffard Park is newly built and does not have a church. Great Linford has St. Andrew's church. At Willen they have quite an old church. The 4 denominations of the ecumenical parish are Methodist, Anglican, Baptist and United Reform Church. A new Roman Catholic church called St. Augustines has been built and opened in the last 5 years at Heelands just off Saxon Street.
